properties.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued January 9 at 1:36PM CST until January 12 at 3:00AM CST by NWS Chicago IL
properties.description:
...Significant Snow and Ice Accumulations Possible late Friday
Night Through Saturday Night...

* WHAT...A mix of freezing rain and sleet likely Friday night and
Saturday, changing to a period of heavy snow late Saturday
afternoon and night. Total ice and sleet accumulations in excess
of two tenths of an inch are possible late Friday night into
Saturday. Total snow accumulations in excess of 6 inches are
also possible late Saturday and Saturday night. Winds could gust
as high as 40 mph Friday night and Saturday.

* WHERE...North central and portions of northeast Illinois.

* WHEN...From Friday evening through late Saturday night.

* IMPACTS...Power outages and tree damage are possible due to the
ice and windy conditions. Travel could be significantly impacted
across the area Friday night through Saturday evening.
properties.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.

NWSheadline: WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY EVENING THROUGH LATE SATURDAY NIGHT
